content.description: Excellent techy vert climb with horizontals and blocky gastons. Start low on a horizontal seam, climb straight up.
content.location: Walking downstream from the Main Area, you'll eventually get to a fork in the trail, go right and uphill toward the bluff, then you'll reach the Golf Ball Boulder, where this climb is located on the north face

content.description: Excellent panel of orange rock, starting left hand on arete and right hand in undercling. Pop up to the solid crimp edge, then good holds for the topout. Straightforward and fun, just crimp hard.
content.location: south face of the DK boulder, up on a little platform of talus

content.description: AMAZING arete climb, how is this not talked about more? Had to clean up some branches around it, so it hasn't been done in a while. Start sitting on a horizontal blocky feature on the arete of the Golf Ball Boulder just uphill from The Place To Be. Climb up the arete on sidepulls and a small left hand crimp. Stand up tall to the top and reap in the views. Amazing.
content.location: northeast arete of the Golf Ball Boulder

content.description: The big one I've been eyeing since I first went out to Cline. Start on a jug on the left and climb up through overhanging big holds and sidepulls to a refrigerator block, then rest on top of the block on jugs and prepare for the thin section up top. Already 10 feet off the deck, half-pad crimps and a sloper will lead you to a final jug at 20 feet, then bigger holds to top this dream out.Â First scouted this line in the spring of '21, ran a few laps on it on a toprope I threw down. Came back in the fall with a bunch of pads and a crew of spotters, and fired the rig. Could I have sunk 2-3 bolts in it? Yea. But with a nice flat landing and great exposure I knew that highballing this line was the way to go.
content.location: Located along the bluff, downstream of the power lines. When you're on the trail, look for a trail that heads up and right through some brush to this nice flat landing below the climb. It's also quite easy to approach this one from the top- the most obvious downstream lookout spot is just above this climb.

content.description: A stunning rail that runs up this slopey boulder. Start sitting down on the right side on some edges, climb up and left into the lip of the boulder then up the rail, finishing around the left side on good holds and big feet. A line that just begs to be climbed; I wouldn't be surprised if it's been climbed before. An homage to the Arkansas stunner Grand Dragon, a leftward-climbing rail, also V7.
content.location: Pretty far downstream. When you're walking downstream from the River Spot, hang a left when you get to a fork, stay as close to the river as you can, and eventually you'll end up right by the river. This climb faces the river and a smaller boulder.

content.description: This area is for all boulders downstream from the main area. Boulders in this area include the Golf Ball Boulder, the Bland Dragon Boulder, and also climbs that are on the bluff, like Dreamline.
